column4: royall: my most common is nearby wlans on close channels. you need two or three channels between yourself and any strong neighbours. do you know a way to scan for local wlans?
yes, have you already done the basics then?
I've plugged and unplugged the flash drive to make sure it is /dev/sdd.  Nautilus refuses to mount it.
is it formatted? if so, what format?
As root I've issued fdisk commands to see what's on it.  I get back nothing.
looks fine for a new/unused usb key. I am assuming there is no data to save on it, As root you did fdisk /dev/sdd ?
It can be wiped.  As root, fdisk /dev/sdd says unable to open /dev/sdd
seems odd. I googled and got a few others with similar probs. Is this one of those usb with security features?
No.  It's an older unit.  On a windows box it gets detected as a removable drive with no media.
divide the probem up and see what is broke. Try another usb key, try a different port,
known working USB flash drive on the same port works fine.
Stand by on checking usb on different port.  The only ones are on the back of the machine and are difficult to reach.
Okay.  Working flash drive on original port works.  Malfunctioning flash drive on different port still unable to fdisk.
